items.title: Translating Requirements into CARLA Executable Scripts: an LLM-Driven Automated Scenario Realization
items.authors: Shiyang Guan, Yijun Lu, Jati H. Husen, Haowei Cheng, Hironori Washizaki, Naoyasu Ubayashi, Nobukazu Yoshioka
items.abstract: Scenario-based testing is critical for ensuring safety and robustness of autonomous driving systems. This work integrates LLMs with M3S descriptions to automatically generate CARLA executable scripts with higher efficiency and lower manual effort.

items.title: Enhancing Safety in Autonomous Driving: Integrating CARLA for Multi-Sensor Dataset Generation and Advanced Scenario Testing
items.authors: Shiyang Guan, Yijun Lu, Jati H. Husen, Haowei Cheng, Hironori Washizaki, Naoyasu Ubayashi, Nobukazu Yoshioka
items.abstract: This study uses CARLA for scenario construction and multi-sensor data generation under diverse traffic and weather settings, supporting robust autonomous driving evaluations.

items.title: VRTopic: Advancing Topic Modeling in Virtual Reality User Reviews with Large Language Models
items.authors: Yijun Lu, Haowei Cheng, Jati H. Husen, Hironori Washizaki, Naoyasu Ubayashi, Nobukazu Yoshioka
items.abstract: This work applies LLMs to extract and summarize key topics from VR user reviews, reducing manual labeling effort and improving interpretability for VR developers.

items.title: Generative AI for Requirements Engineering: A Systematic Literature Review
items.authors: Haowei Cheng, Jati H. Husen, Sien Reeve Peralta, Bowen Jiang, Nobukazu Yoshioka, Naoyasu Ubayashi, Hironori Washizaki
items.abstract: A systematic literature review analyzing applications, challenges, and opportunities of GenAI in requirements engineering across the lifecycle.

items.title: Analysis of Spectro-Temporal Modulation Representation for Deep-Fake Speech Detection
items.authors: Haowei Cheng, Candy Olivia Mawalim, Kai Li, Lijun Wang, Masashi Unoki
items.abstract: This paper investigates spectro-temporal modulation features inspired by human auditory processing for deep-fake speech detection.

items.title: Study on Deep-Fake Speech Detection Based on Spectro-Temporal Modulation Representation
items.authors: Haowei Cheng, Candy Olivia Mawalim, Kai Li, Masashi Unoki
items.abstract: A study on spectro-temporal modulation representation for deep-fake speech detection in Japanese research forum settings.
